oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Davidson County Public Building and Courthouse, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1937
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph related to the construction of The Davidson County Courthouse. This 8-story Art Deco building was completed in 1937, featured with city and county offices, three floors of courtrooms, and the county jail. The structure was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. Architects Emmons H. Woolwine of Nashville and Frederic C. Hirons of New York designed this preeminent example of the Public Works Administration-influenced Modern style in Middle Tennessee. Forms part of the Metro Nashville Archives Photographs, Buildings, Oversize.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Davidson County Court House (Nashville, Tenn.)
